page.title: 02BARNBOUGLE CASTLE
page.content: The original owners of{Barnbougle {Castle}were the{Moubrays,}Knights Templar, who after giving up their Crusades went to live there and took up smuggling.In 1615 they sold the castle to the{Earls of Haddington, leaving behind a large quantity of gunpowder which blew the roof off. In 1662,{Sir Archibald Primrose of {Carrington}purchased the castle.His son was created 1st Earl of Rosebery in 1703 and the Roseberys lived there until 1817. Barnbougle Castle is a plain lofty 13th century building with few architectural details.It is one of the earliest instances of the abandonment of the old enclosing wall for an open defenceless enclosure. { Adam's}scheme was for a triangular castle pointing to the Forth but was redesigned for the 5th Earl.
